text_sanskrit: धृतराष्ट्र उवाच | धर्मक्षेत्रे कुरुक्षेत्रे समवेता युयुत्सवः | मामकाः पाण्डवाश्चैव किमकुर्वत सञ्जय ||
text_transliteration: dhṛtarāṣṭra uvāca | dharma-kṣetre kuru-kṣetre samavetā yuyutsavaḥ | māmakāḥ pāṇḍavāś caiva kim akurvata sañjaya ||
text_english: Dhritarashtra said: O Sanjaya, assembled on the sacred field of Kurukshetra, eager to fight, what did my sons and the sons of Pandu do?
speaker: Dhritarashtra

text_sanskrit: सञ्जय उवाच | दृष्ट्वा तु पाण्डवानीकं व्यूढं दुर्योधनस्तदा | आचार्यमुपसङ्गम्य राजा वचनमब्रवीत् ||
text_transliteration: sañjaya uvāca | dṛṣṭvā tu pāṇḍavānīkaṃ vyūḍhaṃ duryodhanas tadā | ācāryam upasaṅgamya rājā vacanam abravīt ||
text_english: Sanjaya said: Having seen the army of the Pandavas drawn up in battle formation, King Duryodhana approached his teacher Drona and spoke these words.
speaker: Sanjaya

text_sanskrit: पश्यैतां पाण्डुपुत्राणामाचार्य महतीं चमूम् | व्यूढां द्रुपदपुत्रेण तव शिष्येण धीमता ||
text_transliteration: paśyaitāṃ pāṇḍu-putrāṇām ācārya mahatīṃ camūm | vyūḍhāṃ drupada-putreṇa tava śiṣyeṇa dhīmatā ||
text_english: Behold, O Teacher, this mighty army of the sons of Pandu, arrayed by your intelligent disciple, the son of Drupada.
speaker: Duryodhana

text_sanskrit: अत्र शूरा महेष्वासा भीमार्जुनसमा युधि | युयुधानो विराटश्च द्रुपदश्च महारथः ||
text_transliteration: atra śūrā maheṣvāsā bhīmārjuna-samā yudhi | yuyudhāno virāṭaś ca drupadaś ca mahā-rathaḥ ||
text_english: Here are heroes, mighty archers, equal in battle to Bhima and Arjuna: Yuyudhana, Virata, and Drupada, the great chariot-warrior.
speaker: Duryodhana

text_sanskrit: धृष्टकेतुश्चेकितानः काशिराजश्च वीर्यवान् | पुरुजित्कुन्तिभोजश्च शैब्यश्च नरपुङ्गवः ||
text_transliteration: dhṛṣṭaketuś cekitānaḥ kāśirājaś ca vīryavān | purujit kuntibhojaś ca śaibyaś ca nara-puṅgavaḥ ||
text_english: Dhrishtaketu, Chekitana, the valiant King of Kashi, Purujit, Kuntibhoja, and Shaibya, the best among men.
speaker: Duryodhana

text_sanskrit: युधामन्युश्च विक्रान्त उत्तमौजाश्च वीर्यवान् | सौभद्रो द्रौपदेयाश्च सर्व एव महारथाः ||
text_transliteration: yudhāmanyuś ca vikrānta uttamaujāś ca vīryavān | saubhadro draupadeyāś ca sarva eva mahā-rathāḥ ||
text_english: The heroic Yudhamanyu, the valiant Uttamauja, the son of Subhadra, and the sons of Draupadi—all great chariot-warriors.
speaker: Duryodhana

text_sanskrit: अस्माकं तु विशिष्टा ये तान्निबोध द्विजोत्तम | नायका मम सैन्यस्य संज्ञार्थं तान्ब्रवीमि ते ||
text_transliteration: asmākaṃ tu viśiṣṭā ye tān nibodha dvi-jottama | nāyakā mama sainyasya saṃjñārthaṃ tān bravīmi te ||
text_english: O best of the twice-born, know also the distinguished ones among us, the leaders of my army. I shall name them for your information.
speaker: Duryodhana

text_sanskrit: भवान्भीष्मश्च कर्णश्च कृपश्च समितिञ्जयः | अश्वत्थामा विकर्णश्च सौमदत्तिस्तथैव च ||
text_transliteration: bhavān bhīṣmaś ca karṇaś ca kṛpaś ca samitiñjayaḥ | aśvatthāmā vikarṇaś ca saumadattis tathaiva ca ||
text_english: Yourself, Bhishma, Karna, Kripa—ever victorious in battle—Ashwatthama, Vikarna, and also the son of Somadatta.
speaker: Duryodhana

text_sanskrit: अन्ये च बहवः शूरा मदर्थे त्यक्तजीविताः | नानाशस्त्रप्रहरणाः सर्वे युद्धविशारदाः ||
text_transliteration: anye ca bahavaḥ śūrā mad-arthe tyakta-jīvitāḥ | nānā-śastra-praharaṇāḥ sarve yuddha-viśāradāḥ ||
text_english: And many other heroes ready to give up their lives for my sake, equipped with various weapons and missiles, all skilled in the art of warfare.
speaker: Duryodhana

text_sanskrit: अपर्याप्तं तदस्माकं बलं भीष्माभिरक्षितम् | पर्याप्तं त्विदमेतेषां बलं भीमाभिरक्षितम् ||
text_transliteration: aparyāptaṃ tad asmākaṃ balaṃ bhīṣmābhirakṣitam | paryāptaṃ tv idam eteṣāṃ balaṃ bhīmābhirakṣitam ||
text_english: The strength of our army is unlimited and we are safely marshalled by Grandsire Bheeshma, while the strength of the Pandava army, carefully marshalled by Bheem, is limited.
speaker: Duryodhana

text_sanskrit: अयनेषु च सर्वेषु यथाभागमवस्थिता: | भीष्ममेवाभिरक्षन्तु भवन्त: सर्व एव हि ||
text_transliteration: ayaneṣhu cha sarveṣhu yathā-bhāgamavasthitāḥ | bhīṣhmamevābhirakṣhantu bhavantaḥ sarva eva hi ||
text_english: Therefore, I call upon all the generals of the Kaurava army now to give full support to Grandsire Bheeshma, even as you defend your respective strategic points.
speaker: Duryodhana

text_sanskrit: तस्य सञ्जनयन्हर्षं कुरुवृद्ध: पितामह: | सिंहनादं विनद्योच्चै: शङ्खं दध्मौ प्रतापवान् ||
text_transliteration: tasya sañjanayan harṣhaṁ kuru-vṛiddhaḥ pitāmahaḥ | siṁha-nādaṁ vinadyochchaiḥ śhaṅkhaṁ dadhmau pratāpavān ||
text_english: Then, the grand old man of the Kuru dynasty, the glorious patriarch Bheeshma, roared like a lion, and blew his conch shell very loudly, giving joy to Duryodhan.
speaker: Duryodhana

text_sanskrit: तत: शङ्खाश्च भेर्यश्च पणवानकगोमुखा: | सहसैवाभ्यहन्यन्त स शब्दस्तुमुलोऽभवत् ||
text_transliteration: tataḥ śhaṅkhāśhcha bheryaśhcha paṇavānaka-gomukhāḥ | sahasaivābhyahanyanta sa śhabdastumulo ’bhavat ||
text_english: Thereafter, conches, kettledrums, bugles, trumpets, and horns suddenly blared forth, and their combined sound was overwhelming.
speaker: Duryodhana

text_sanskrit: तत: श्वेतैर्हयैर्युक्ते महति स्यन्दने स्थितौ | माधव: पाण्डवश्चैव दिव्यौ शङ्खौ प्रदध्मतु: ||
text_transliteration: tataḥ śhvetairhayairyukte mahati syandane sthitau | mādhavaḥ pāṇḍavaśhchaiva divyau śhaṅkhau pradadhmatuḥ ||
text_english: Then, from amidst the Pandava army, seated in a glorious chariot drawn by white horses, Madhav and Arjun blew their Divine conch shells.
speaker: Duryodhana

text_sanskrit: पाञ्चजन्यं हृषीकेशो देवदत्तं धनञ्जय: | पौण्ड्रं दध्मौ महाशङ्खं भीमकर्मा वृकोदर: ||
text_transliteration: pāñchajanyaṁ hṛiṣhīkeśho devadattaṁ dhanañjayaḥ | pauṇḍraṁ dadhmau mahā-śhaṅkhaṁ bhīma-karmā vṛikodaraḥ ||
text_english: Hrishikesh blew his conch shell, called Panchajanya, and Arjun blew the Devadutta. Bheem, the voracious eater and performer of herculean tasks, blew his mighty conch, called Paundra.
speaker: Duryodhana

text_sanskrit: अनन्तविजयं राजा कुन्तीपुत्रो युधिष्ठिर: | नकुल: सहदेवश्च सुघोषमणिपुष्पकौ ||
text_transliteration: anantavijayaṁ rājā kuntī-putro yudhiṣhṭhiraḥ | nakulaḥ sahadevaśhcha sughoṣha-maṇipuṣhpakau ||
text_english: King Yudhishthira, the son of Kunti, blew his conch named Anantavijaya, Nakula and Sahadeva blew their conches called Sughosa and Manipushpaka.
speaker: Duryodhana

text_sanskrit: काश्यश्च परमेष्वास: शिखण्डी च महारथ: | धृष्टद्युम्नो विराटश्च सात्यकिश्चापराजित: ||
text_transliteration: ayaneṣhu cha sarveṣhu yathā-bhāgamavasthitāḥ | bhīṣhmamevābhirakṣhantu bhavantaḥ sarva eva hi ||
text_english: Kashya, the great archer; Shikhandi, the mighty warrior; Dhrishtadyumna, Virata, and Satyaki—the undefeatable—also blew their conches.
speaker: Duryodhana

text_sanskrit: द्रुपदो द्रौपदेयाश्च सर्वश: पृथिवीपते | सौभद्रश्च महाबाहु: शङ्खान्दध्मु: पृथक् पृथक् ||
text_transliteration: drupado draupadeyāśhcha sarvaśhaḥ pṛithivī-pate | saubhadraśhcha mahā-bāhuḥ śhaṅkhāndadhmuḥ pṛithak pṛithak ||
text_english: Drupada, the sons of Draupadi, and O Lord of the Earth, the mighty-armed Abhimanyu—each of them blew their own conch..
speaker: Duryodhana

text_sanskrit: स घोषो धार्तराष्ट्राणां हृदयानि व्यदारयत् | नभश्च पृथिवीं चैव तुमुलोऽभ्यनुनादयन् ||
text_transliteration: sa ghoṣho dhārtarāṣhṭrāṇāṁ hṛidayāni vyadārayat | nabhaśhcha pṛithivīṁ chaiva tumulo abhyanunādayan ||
text_english: The terrific sound thundered across the sky and the earth, and shattered the hearts of your sons, O Dhritarasthra.
speaker: Duryodhana

text_sanskrit: अथ व्यवस्थितान्दृष्ट्वा धार्तराष्ट्रान् कपिध्वज: | प्रवृत्ते शस्त्रसम्पाते धनुरुद्यम्य पाण्डव: | हृषीकेशं तदा वाक्यमिदमाह महीपते ||
text_transliteration: atha vyavasthitān dṛiṣhṭvā dhārtarāṣhṭrān kapi-dhwajaḥ | pravṛitte śhastra-sampāte dhanurudyamya pāṇḍavaḥ | hṛiṣhīkeśhaṁ tadā vākyam idam āha mahī-pate ||
text_english: At that time, the son of Pandu, Arjun, who had the insignia of Hanuman on the flag of his chariot, took up his bow. Seeing your sons arrayed against him, O King, Arjun then spoke the following words to Shree Krishna.
speaker: Duryodhana

text_sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच: सेनयोरुभयोर्मध्ये रथं स्थापय मेऽच्युत ||
text_transliteration: arjuna uvācha: senayor ubhayor madhye rathaṁ sthāpaya me ’chyuta ||
text_english: Arjuna said: “ O Achyuta, place my chariot between the two armies.”
speaker: Arjun

text_sanskrit: यावदेतान्निरीक्षेऽहं योद्धुकामानवस्थितान् | कैर्मया सह योद्धव्यमस्मिन् रणसमुद्यमे ||
text_transliteration: yāvadetān nirīkṣhe ’haṁ yoddhu-kāmān avasthitān | kairmayā saha yoddhavyam asmin raṇa-samudyame ||
text_english: Let me see those who have assembled here, eager to fight, and with whom I must battle in this great war.
speaker: Duryodhana

text_sanskrit: योत्स्यमानानवेक्षेऽहं य एतेऽत्र समागता: | धार्तराष्ट्रस्य दुर्बुद्धेर्युद्धे प्रियचिकीर्षव: ||
text_transliteration: yotsyamānān avekṣhe ’haṁ ya ete ’tra samāgatāḥ | dhārtarāṣhṭrasya durbuddher yuddhe priya-chikīrṣhavaḥ ||
text_english: I desire to see those who have come here to fight on the side of the evil-minded son of Dhritarasthra, wishing to please him.
speaker: Duryodhana

text_sanskrit: सञ्जय उवाच: एवमुक्तो हृषीकेशो गुडाकेशेन भारत | सेनयोरुभयोर्मध्ये स्थापयित्वा रथोत्तमम् ||
text_transliteration: sañjaya uvācha: evam ukto hṛiṣhīkeśho guḍākeśhena bhārata | senayor ubhayor madhye sthāpayitvā rathottamam ||
text_english: Sanjay said: O Dhritarasthra, having thus been addressed by Arjun, the conqueror of sleep, Shree Krishna then drew the magnificent chariot between the two armies.
speaker: Sanjay

text_sanskrit: भीष्मद्रोणप्रमुखत: सर्वेषां च महीक्षिताम् | उवाच पार्थ पश्यैतान्समवेतान्कुरूनिति ||
text_transliteration: bhīṣhma-droṇa-pramukhataḥ sarveṣhāṁ cha mahī-kṣhitām | uvācha pārtha paśhyaitān samavetān kurūn iti ||
text_english: In the presence of Bheeshma, Dronacharya, and all the other kings, Shree Krishna said: O Parth, behold these Kurus gathered here.
speaker: Duryodhana

text_sanskrit: तत्रापश्यत्स्थितान् पार्थ: पितृ नथ पितामहान् | आचार्यान्मातुलान्भ्रातृ न्पुत्रान्पौत्रान्सखींस्तथा || श्वशुरान्सुहृदश्चैव सेनयोरुभयोरपि ||
text_transliteration: tatrāpaśhyat sthitān pārthaḥ pitṝīn atha pitāmahān | āchāryān mātulān bhrātṝīn putrān pautrān sakhīṁs tathā | śhvaśhurān suhṛidaśh chaiva senayor ubhayor api ||
text_english: There, Arjun could see stationed in both armies, his fathers, grandfathers, teachers, maternal uncles, brothers, cousins, sons, nephews, grand-nephews, friends, fathers-in-law, and well-wishers.
speaker: Duryodhana

text_sanskrit: तान्समीक्ष्य स कौन्तेय: सर्वान्बन्धूनवस्थितान् || कृपया परयाविष्टो विषीदन्निदमब्रवीत् |
text_transliteration: tān samīkṣhya sa kaunteyaḥ sarvān bandhūn avasthitān || kṛipayā parayāviṣhṭo viṣhīdann idam abravīt |
text_english: Seeing all his relatives present there, Arjun, the son of Kunti, was overwhelmed with compassion, and with deep sorrow, spoke the following words.
speaker: Duryodhana

text_sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच: दृष्ट्वेमं स्वजनं कृष्ण युयुत्सुं समुपस्थितम् || सीदन्ति मम गात्राणि मुखं च परिशुष्यति ||
text_transliteration: arjuna uvācha: dṛiṣhṭvemaṁ sva-janaṁ kṛiṣhṇa yuyutsuṁ samupasthitam || sīdanti mama gātrāṇi mukhaṁ cha pariśhuṣhyati |
text_english: Arjun said: O Krishna, seeing my own kinsmen arrayed for battle here and intent on killing each other, my limbs are giving way and my mouth is drying up.
speaker: Arjun

text_sanskrit: वेपथुश्च शरीरे मे रोमहर्षश्च जायते || गाण्डीवं स्रंसते हस्तात्त्वक्चै व परिदह्यते ||
text_transliteration: vepathuśh cha śharīre me roma-harṣhaśh cha jāyate || gāṇḍīvaṁ sraṁsate hastāt tvak chaiva paridahyate ||
text_english: My body is trembling, my hair is standing on end. Gandiva is slipping from my hand, and my skin is burning
speaker: Duryodhana

text_sanskrit: न च शक्नोम्यवस्थातुं भ्रमतीव च मे मन: ||
text_transliteration: na cha śhaknomy avasthātuṁ bhramatīva cha me manaḥ ||
text_english: I am unable to stand firm, and my mind seems to be reeling.
speaker: Duryodhana

text_sanskrit: निमित्तानि च पश्यामि विपरीतानि केशव | न च श्रेयोऽनुपश्यामि हत्वा स्वजनमाहवे ||
text_transliteration: nimittāni cha paśhyāmi viparītāni keśhava | na cha śhreyo ’nupaśhyāmi hatvā sva-janam āhave ||
text_english: O Keshava, I see omens that are unfavorable, and I do not foresee any good in killing my own people in this battle.
speaker: Duryodhana

text_sanskrit: अयनेषु च सर्वेषु यथाभागमवस्थिता: | भीष्ममेवाभिरक्षन्तु भवन्त: सर्व एव हि ||
text_transliteration: ayaneṣhu cha sarveṣhu yathā-bhāgamavasthitāḥ | bhīṣhmamevābhirakṣhantu bhavantaḥ sarva eva hi ||
text_english: Therefore, I call upon all the generals of the Kaurava army now to give full support to Grandsire Bheeshma, even as you defend your respective strategic points.
speaker: Duryodhana

text_sanskrit: अयनेषु च सर्वेषु यथाभागमवस्थिता: | भीष्ममेवाभिरक्षन्तु भवन्त: सर्व एव हि ||
text_transliteration: ayaneṣhu cha sarveṣhu yathā-bhāgamavasthitāḥ | bhīṣhmamevābhirakṣhantu bhavantaḥ sarva eva hi ||
text_english: Therefore, I call upon all the generals of the Kaurava army now to give full support to Grandsire Bheeshma, even as you defend your respective strategic points.
speaker: Duryodhana

text_sanskrit: अयनेषु च सर्वेषु यथाभागमवस्थिता: | भीष्ममेवाभिरक्षन्तु भवन्त: सर्व एव हि ||
text_transliteration: ayaneṣhu cha sarveṣhu yathā-bhāgamavasthitāḥ | bhīṣhmamevābhirakṣhantu bhavantaḥ sarva eva hi ||
text_english: Therefore, I call upon all the generals of the Kaurava army now to give full support to Grandsire Bheeshma, even as you defend your respective strategic points.
speaker: Duryodhana

text_sanskrit: अयनेषु च सर्वेषु यथाभागमवस्थिता: | भीष्ममेवाभिरक्षन्तु भवन्त: सर्व एव हि ||
text_transliteration: ayaneṣhu cha sarveṣhu yathā-bhāgamavasthitāḥ | bhīṣhmamevābhirakṣhantu bhavantaḥ sarva eva hi ||
text_english: Therefore, I call upon all the generals of the Kaurava army now to give full support to Grandsire Bheeshma, even as you defend your respective strategic points.
speaker: Duryodhana

text_sanskrit: अयनेषु च सर्वेषु यथाभागमवस्थिता: | भीष्ममेवाभिरक्षन्तु भवन्त: सर्व एव हि ||
text_transliteration: ayaneṣhu cha sarveṣhu yathā-bhāgamavasthitāḥ | bhīṣhmamevābhirakṣhantu bhavantaḥ sarva eva hi ||
text_english: Therefore, I call upon all the generals of the Kaurava army now to give full support to Grandsire Bheeshma, even as you defend your respective strategic points.
speaker: Duryodhana

text_sanskrit: अयनेषु च सर्वेषु यथाभागमवस्थिता: | भीष्ममेवाभिरक्षन्तु भवन्त: सर्व एव हि ||
text_transliteration: ayaneṣhu cha sarveṣhu yathā-bhāgamavasthitāḥ | bhīṣhmamevābhirakṣhantu bhavantaḥ sarva eva hi ||
text_english: Therefore, I call upon all the generals of the Kaurava army now to give full support to Grandsire Bheeshma, even as you defend your respective strategic points.
speaker: Duryodhana

text_sanskrit: अयनेषु च सर्वेषु यथाभागमवस्थिता: | भीष्ममेवाभिरक्षन्तु भवन्त: सर्व एव हि ||
text_transliteration: ayaneṣhu cha sarveṣhu yathā-bhāgamavasthitāḥ | bhīṣhmamevābhirakṣhantu bhavantaḥ sarva eva hi ||
text_english: Therefore, I call upon all the generals of the Kaurava army now to give full support to Grandsire Bheeshma, even as you defend your respective strategic points.
speaker: Duryodhana
